items.title: [FEATURE] SIMD for stereo processing
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently this plugin is quite expensive on the CPU.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It may be possible to interleave the channels for a stereo signal, and then use SIMD processing to process multiple channels in parallel. This won't be possible for every part of the plugin, but I want to see if it can at least be done for the "Hysteresis" section which typically eats up the most CPU.

items.title: Compression addition
items.body:
While using this on EVERY mix I do - CHOWTapeModel is an amazing mastering plugin for providing a tape-sound - I am wondering if there is a way to create within the plugin a 'magnetic compression' sound on the peaks.  I am almost willing to bet that this exists already, and I'm just missing it.

I remember (and still experience) recording through various tape-recorders, when a transient it heavy, there's sometimes a degradation in the overall signal for just that specific moment.  Often described as a 'squish' or 'glue' sound when using audio compressors, but specific to tape recording, it provides a volume compression, but also a timbral change in sound.

items.title: [FEATURE] Running the plugin headless
items.body:
Hey guys, just asking this to satisfy my inner nerd. :D

Is it possible to build/run this plugin as headless on the Raspberry Pi? I love love love the sonic character that the plugin creates and was humouring the thought of running this as a sort of live pedal effect via the RPi. Perfect setup would be just to feed it a config file where it would read the settings and then just run it, letting it process any incoming audio. \o/

items.title: Compilation segfaults at 81% on AVL-MXE (based on Debian 10)
items.body:
Thanks for your great projects!

Unfortunately the Linux Deb packages provided for Ubuntu don't really work dependency wise for people with Debian systems as there are minor differences with libcurl versions etc. I am attempting to compile the ChowDSP plugins on AV Linux MX Edition which is currently based on Debian 10 Buster. I have successfully been able to compile Chow Centaur but am having difficulties with Analog Tape Model. I have all required dependencies and CMake but for some reason the compilation segfaults at 81% with the following error:

```
[ 80%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/CHOWTapeModel_LV2.dir/modules/JUCE/modules/juce_audio_plugin_client/juce_audio_plugin_client_VST3.cpp.o
[ 81%] Linking CXX shared module CHOWTapeModel_artefacts/LV2/CHOWTapeModel.lv2/CHOWTapeModel.so
Generate ttl data for './CHOWTapeModel.so', basename: 'CHOWTapeModel'
Segmentation fault
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/CHOWTapeModel_LV2.dir/build.make:242: CHOWTapeModel_artefacts/LV2/CHOWTapeModel.lv2/CHOWTapeModel.so] Error 139
make[2]: *** Deleting file 'CHOWTapeModel_artefacts/LV2/CHOWTapeModel.lv2/CHOWTapeModel.so'
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:345: CMakeFiles/CHOWTapeModel_LV2.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [Makefile:130: all] Error 2
```

This is building the GIT repo version as instructed in your build docs. It seems odd to me to have something segfault during compilation. Any ideas or suggestions?

items.title: [Discussion] Should Oversampling be saved in presets?
items.body:
Currently oversampling is saved in presets, but i'm not sure if it should, typically it's something you would set depending on where you use it and how powerful your machine is, not really on the settings of a preset (perhaps it matters if your preset uses a lot of gain for overdrive).  
  
In a hypothetical situation with how it works right now, let's say you wanted to add some tape flavour when mastering, naturally, the first thing you'd do is set the highest oversampling setting, you'd change some settings around, decide you'd want to use some preset instead, start scrolling through them. Your oversampling setting would get overwritten with the (typically low) one from a preset, potentially doing so without you noticing and possibly introducing some aliasing to your master. This could be made even worse when #198 is implemented, as you wouldn't hear the problem right away.  
  
I'm interested to hear what other people think of this.

items.title: blank update screen on some PCs
items.body:
Hello, 
Firstly thank you for your excellent freeware plugins!
We have just rebuilt the PCs in our music classroom and on some PCs the update screen for ChowTapeModel is blank. Other machines it shows fine and you can either click yes or no.
The screens that are blank you can still select presets and this will affect the sound but you cannot adjust any of the parameters. 
![Screenshot (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85342697/120791056-9d677200-c52b-11eb-9ae3-9f0bf2d6d005.png)
I have tried updating both this plugin and also the ChowMatrix. The update works when running the .exe installer but it will not work when copying the .vst3 file directly to another PC. I have tried clearing the cache and rescanning VSTs and i have tried restarting the PC.
We like to be able to copy the plugins directly so it is easy to rebuild the room rather than having to run lots of installers on lots of PCs one after another.
Some plugins we use have files that also need copying to ProgramData, but I couldn't see anything there for ChowDSP and the last versions worked great only copying the .vst3 file.
Any help you can offer would be greatly appreciated :-)
Many thanks,
Stephen

items.title: Feature request - offline oversampling settings
items.body: It'd be great to be able to set different oversampling settings for realtime & render, so that realtime playback can be at a lower setting and a much higher setting used for rendering.

items.title: [FEATURE] More dynamic or adjustability of the parameter azimuth
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Since the new version 2.8.0 there is finally an azimuth parameter. This is great in principle, because it makes the simulation much more realistic.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
However, what is still missing is somehow a kind of dynamic setting of the value. If I currently specify a value here, then this is statically applied to the signal over the entire time. Could not notice any change, at least at first glance, when I changed other parameters. For real tape recordings, however, this is not the case. To emulate the sound of a real tape recorder, this value would also have to contain a certain dynamic. Azimuth can be very small but also large during playback - i.e. sometimes the phase shift is larger, then smaller again. I know this only too well from digitizing old recordings. There I already had the craziest discoveries depending on the tape age.

Therefore it would be desirable if the whole thing was a bit more realistic. 

**Additional context**
Would be very happy to provide more info, but the requirement is very difficult to prove well with pictures, because it depends on the signal.

items.title: [BUG] Deb package has unnecessary -dev dependencies.
items.body:
Hi!

**Describe the bug**
Deb package has -dev dependencies.

If you look into package:
```Depends: libasound2-dev, libcurl4-openssl-dev, libx11-dev, libxinerama-dev, libxext-dev, libfreetype6-dev, libwebkit2gtk-4.0-dev, libglu1-mesa-dev```
these packages may needed for build but not for binaries.

I haven't find build script for that. Perhaps these packages are listed in debian.control.

items.title: Degrade scales up very quickly
items.body: The _Depth_ control of the Degrade section scales the effect up pretty quickly if the _Amount_ value is anything beyond a low number. Sometimes it's nice to have some barely detectable tape hiss on the master -- barely detectable even when wearing headphones. So my preference would be finer control over lower depth values, if possible.

items.title: [FEATURE] Envelope Follower for Degrade Noise
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The noise from the Degrade section is very static.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The Degrade section should have a "Release" parameter, so that the noise is enveloped to the amplitude of the original signal. When the "Release" is at the maximum value, the noise will revert to the static behaviour that it currently uses.

From KVR User Broken Spirit:
> The wow and flutter are just right but finding the right speed and how much depth to add is hard. If you can make the setting so the 3.75, 7.5, 15, 30 ips tape speeds are linked to the rate and depth. Along with that the wow and flutter could linked setting to make it more reel to real.

items.title: Fix filter stability issue in tone filters
items.body: Refactored tone filters to use Shelf filter from chowdsp_utils, with corrected coefficient calculation. Fixes #134.

items.title: Use RTNeural for Hysteresis STN Mode
items.body:
The State Transition Network used by the Hysteresis "STN" mode is a small dense neural network. This should be ported to use the [RTNeural](https://github.com/jatinchowdhury18/RTNeural) library as a submodule.

From there, we need to do performance benchmarking to see which RTNeural backend is fastest... I have a feeling it's going to be xsimd.

items.body:

The Wow processing is a little too plain and predictable.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Some control to add randomness to the wow processing (maybe Brownian motion...)

items.title: [BUG] [Reaper] Tone Control Stability
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Plugin going unstable in Reaper, when using extreme settings in Tone Control. Nothing sees to reset the state except re-instantiating the plugin.

**To Reproduce**
1. Bypass all processors except tone
2. Put one of the tone filters at +1
3. Put the other filter in (-0.75, -1.0)
4. Put the tone frequency to > 3k
5. Output will go unstable.

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/787744824052023306/811749780321337364/unknown.png)

**Expected behavior**
Plugin should not go unstable for any tone control settings. Even if it does, normal behaviour should be recoverable without re-instantiating.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - DAW: Reaper
 - Version: 2.7.0

**Additional context**
Reported by @mkruselj.

items.title: [FEATURE] Better parameter naming scheme
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When looking at the parameter list in a DAW (useful for automation) some of the parameter names are not very descriptive (for example there are two parameters called "Depth").

![](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/787744824052023306/811742155819057152/unknown.png?width=151&height=613)

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Each parameter should have a unique descriptive name when looked at in a DAW.

**Additional context**
I think the parameter names are currently linked to the slider captions in the UI. I need to double check if this is the case.

items.title: [BUG] Could not install in MacOS
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Could not get the vst to run on Mac BigSur

**To Reproduce**
I downloaded the package and installed the .vst in the plugin-folder VST (and the app in the apps-folder). When I startup Reason DAW I got several mentions, that this is from unknown developer. Inside Reason it is shown as unknown developer and unknown type (none of  instrument, effect...). When I enable it and restart Reason nothing changes.

In the System Preferences this is also recognized: CHOWTapeModel.vst was blocked ... because it is from not identfied developer.
I tried to press the button "Open Anyway", but there is no effect.

When I use only the .vst3 plugin (installed into plugins/VST3) nothing happens.

**Expected behavior**
Should work after installation.

**Screenshots**
Could make them, if you really mean that would help. :)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - MacOS Big Sur
 - Reason 11

**Additional context**
I'm really new to this world of plugins. I would not wonder, if it was my fault. Then I'm sorry but would be glad, if got some help.
If not: My simplest estimated guess is, that this is because it has no plugin-type, Reason doesn't know what to do with it.

items.title: Improve exception safety with smart pointers
items.body:
Would you like to wrap any pointer data members with the class template “[std::unique_ptr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smart_pointer#unique_ptr "Description for the usage of smart pointers")”?

Update candidates:
- [FIRFilter](https://github.com/jatinchowdhury18/AnalogTapeModel/blob/7aebad0004bff6611f28124e8457dbf53a3b4ea0/Plugin/Source/Processors/Loss_Effects/FIRFilter.h#L11)
- [GRULayer](https://github.com/jatinchowdhury18/AnalogTapeModel/blob/7aebad0004bff6611f28124e8457dbf53a3b4ea0/Plugin/Source/Processors/Hysteresis/RTNeural/src/gru.cpp#L6)

items.title: Compile with CMake instead of Projucer
Migrate to CMake
items.body:
JUCE6 has CMake support, and now that we've figured out how build LV2 plugins with JUCE/CMake, CHOWTape should be migrated to CMake.

CMake will allow the following improvements:
- Run CI on WIndows
- Run benchmarks using shared code

items.title: Fix gain staging bug in Renoise
[BUG] Loading CHOWTapeModel from an Instrument or Audio Effect Rack on a track in Ableton Live 10 causes the DAW to crash
items.body:
When CHOWTapeModel is loaded on a track from an Audio Effect Rack or Instrument Rack preset, the audio engine halts and after ~5 seconds Ableton Live displays the "A serious program error has occurred." error message, closing the program when OK is pressed.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Load CHOWTapeModel to a MIDI or audio track from Audio Effects folder
2. Select CHOWTapeModel in the detail view and press Ctrl-G or right click and press Group to place the track in an Audio Effect Rack
3. Press the Save Preset button in the top right of the Audio Effect Rack with the chain list expanded and save the preset to User Library
4. With another MIDI or audio track selected, double click the saved Audio Effect Rack preset, this should replicate the bug

The same behavior occurs when an Instrument Rack preset with CHOWTapeModel is loaded instead of an Audio Effect Rack

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Windows 10
 - Ableton Live 10
 - 2.70
 - 64 bit

items.title: [BUG] Audio instability at extreme values of tone treble, bass, and frequency
items.body:
In the tone section, if treble is set to -1.0, bass is set to 1.0, and frequency is set to a value at around 2.9kHz or higher, the audio will pop and then become permanently silent.

If treble is set to 1.0 and bass is set to -1.0, the audio will become unstable and continuously output heavy distortion.

In both cases, the instability only happens if the input is not silent.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - DAW: Renoise
 - Version: 2.7
 - 64 bit

[unstable patches.zip](https://github.com/jatinchowdhury18/AnalogTapeModel/files/5768367/unstable.patches.zip)

items.title: hack? How to install on Catalina
items.body:
The plugins would not load in Live, so I googled and found this guide:

https://www.osirisguitar.com/how-to-make-unsigned-vsts-work-in-macos-catalina/

It's fairly simple if you know how to do simple things in the terminal. 

I'm writing this to suggest that you offer up this information alongside the download.

items.title: [FEATURE] mono version
items.body: To reduce resource usage, a mono version would be very welcome.
